sen.j: 阿閉 貞征（あつじ さだゆき、享禄元年（1528年） - 天正10年6月18日 (旧暦)（1582年7月7日））は戦国時代 (日本)の武将で、浅井氏、織田氏の家臣。
sen.e: Sadayuki ATSUJI (1528 - July 7, 1582) was a Japanese military commander and a vassal of the Asai and the Oda clans during the Sengoku Period.

sen.e: Sadayuki ATSUJI (1528 - July 7, 1582) was a Japanese military commander and vassal of the Asai and the Oda clans during the Sengoku Period.

sen.j: 淡路守の受領名を自称。
sen.e: Sadayuki also called himself as Awaji no kami (the governor of Awaji Province, a honorary title given only to people with excellent talents).

sen.e: Sadayuki claimed to be Awaji no kami (the governor of Awaji Province).

sen.j: 藤堂高虎や渡辺了も一時期阿閉家臣として仕えていた。
sen.e: Takatora TODO (a military commander and a feudal lord, who served the Tokugawa family as a senior vassal) and Satoru WATANABE (an excellent samurai worked for Nobunaga ODA and Hideyoshi HASHIBA) also served as a vassal of the Atsuji family for a short period of time.
Takatora TODO and Satoru WATANABE, both of whom were military commanders, also served as a vassal of the Atsuji clan for a short period of time.
sen.cmt: 括弧内の説明は不要と判断しました。「武将であった」という説明で十分と判断しました。
sen.e: Takatora TODO and Satoru WATANABE, both of whom were military commanders, also served as a vassal of the Atsuji clan for a short period of time.

sen.j: 代々北近江、伊香郡の国人であったが、浅井氏が京極氏に代わって勢力を拡大すると、浅井氏に従うようになった。
sen.e: Although the Atsuji family succeeded to the post of a local lord for generations in Ika County, Kitaomi, once the Asai clan replaced the Kyogoku clan and expanded its power in the area, the Atsuji family started serving the Asai clan.
The Atsuji clan, having served as the local lord in Ika County, Kitaomi, for generations, worked for the Asai clan who became more powerful than the Kyogoku clan.
The Atsuji clan, having served as the local lord in Ika County, Kitaomi, for generations, worked for the Asai clan who became more powerful than the Kyogoku clan.

sen.j: 貞征は浅井家中では重臣で、北国街道や奥琵琶湖を見渡せる要害山本山城を任されていた。
sen.e: Sadayuki was assigned to a senior vassal of the Asai family, taking charge of a fortress, the Yamamotoyama Castle, which overlooked Hokkoku Kaido Road and Biwa-ko Lake.
As a senior vassal of the Asai clan, Sadayuki was assigned to the fortified Yamamotoyama Castle which overlooked Hokkoku Kaido Road and the Lake Biwa.
sen.cmt: 「要害山本山城」は「要塞化した山本山城」としました。
sen.e: As a senior vassal of the Asai clan, Sadayuki was assigned to the fortified Yamamotoyama Castle which overlooked Hokkoku Kaido Road and the Lake Biwa.

sen.j: 姉川の戦いには1,000騎を率いて参陣。
sen.e: In the Battle of Anegawa, Sadayuki led a troop of one thousand horsemen.

sen.j: 磯野員昌、浅井政澄に続く3段目に布陣した。
sen.e: He lined up as the third squad after Kazumasa ISONO and Masazumi ASAI.
He lined up in the third row after Kazumasa ISONO and Masazumi ASAI.
sen.cmt: 「３段目に布陣」は「３列目に布陣」と解しました。
sen.e: He lined up in the third row after Kazumasa ISONO and Masazumi ASAI.

sen.j: 姉川の戦い後も対織田戦に参陣し、山本山城が信長の攻撃を受けるもこれを撃退していた。
sen.e: Even after the Battle of Anegawa, Sadayuki continued fighting against the Oda army, beating back the attack against the Yamatoyama Castle by Nobunaga ODA.

sen.j: しかし1573年、信長に内応し山本山に織田勢を引き入れたため、小谷城は孤立し主家滅亡の遠因をつくる。
sen.e: However, in 1573, Sadayuki betrayed the Asai family to take side of Nobunaga and let the Oda army in the Yamamotoyama Castle, which resulted in the isolation of Odani-jo Castle, the main castle of the Asai family and lead to the ultimate downfall of his once master, the Asai family.
However, in 1573, Sadayuki betrayed the Asai clan to let the Oda army in the Yamamotoyama Castle, which resulted in the isolation of the Odani-jo Castle leading to the ultimate downfall of the clan.

sen.j: 主家滅亡後は、子の阿閉貞大とともに織田家に降りすぐに朝倉攻めの先手を務めている。
sen.e: As soon as the Asai family fell, Sadayuki joined the Oda family with his son, Sadahiro ATSUJI, to attack the Asakura family at the forefront.
After the Asai clan fell, Sadayuki joined the Oda clan with his son, Sadahiro ATSUJI, to lead the way to attack the Asakura clan.

sen.j: 江北は、豊臣秀吉に一職支配権が与えられ阿閉は、山本山城と伊香郡内の本領を安堵されて、秀吉の与力となる。
sen.e: While Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI was given the integrated control over the northern part of the Omi Province (Kohoku), the ATSUJI family was approved of the proprietary of the Yamamotoyama Castle and a main domain inside the Ika County and appointed as a police sergeant of Hideyoshi.

While Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI took control of Kitaomi, the ATSUJI clan, approved of the proprietary of the Yamamotoyama Castle and the main domain in the Ika County, was appointed as yoriki (mounted warrior belonging to a general in the Sengoku period).
sen.cmt: ・出典元では「江北」ではなく、「北近江」なので、「北近江は、豊臣秀吉に・・・」としました。・「与力」は翻訳で採用されたのとは別の定訳を採用しました（尚、定訳ではbelonged to a general…となっていますが、belonging が正当と思われます。
sen.e: While Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI took control of Kitaomi, the ATSUJI clan, approved of the proprietary of the Yamamotoyama Castle and the main domain in the Ika County, was appointed as yoriki (mounted warrior belonging to a general in the Sengoku period).

sen.j: しかし、次第に秀吉の圧迫が募り竹生島にある扶持を秀吉に取られた為、貞大が信長側近の菅屋長頼に訴えている。
sen.e: However, as Hideyoshi started putting pressure on the Atsuji family and even illegally took away the stipend gathered in Chikubushima Island for the family, angry Sadahiro filed a complaint to one of Nobunaga's aids, Nagayori SUGAYA.
However, because Hideyoshi became so powerful as to occupy the stipend gathered in Chikubushima Island, Sadahiro filed a complaint to one of Nobunaga's aids, Nagayori SUGAYA.

sen.j: 天正5年より秀吉は、播磨に赴くが阿閉親子は、近江に駐まり信長の旗本となっている。
sen.e: In 1577, Hideyoshi moved to Harima with his army, but Sadayuki and Sadahiro ATSUJI remained in Omi, where they were appointed as a hatamoto (bannerman) of Nobunaga.
In 1577, Hideyoshi moved to Harima, but Sadayuki and Sadahiro ATSUJI remained in Omi to work as Nobunaga's hatamoto (bannerman).

sen.j: その後、越前の一向宗との戦い等に参陣。
sen.e: Later, Sadayuki and Sadahiro ATSUJI joined the battles including the one against the Ikko sect in Echizen.

sen.j: 1582年、本能寺の変で明智光秀に加担して、秀吉の居城・長浜城 (近江国)を攻めた。
sen.e: In 1582, Sadayuki and Sadahiro ATSUJI took side of Mitsuhide AKECHI in the Honnoji Incident and attacked the Nagahama Castle (Omi Province), the main castle of Hideyoshi.

sen.j: しかし、山崎の合戦で光秀が打ち破られると秀吉に追討され一族全て殺されてしまった。
sen.e: However, as soon as Mitsuhide died in the Battle of Yamasaki, the entire ATSUJI family was hunted down and killed by Hideyoshi.
